anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch74864 [Suuko], an idol-loving http://anidb.net/t876 [hikikomori], has one ability: to make any idol popular through the power of blogging. She puts her sights on the Fukuoka idol trio Itorio and tries to make them sell more, but she is impeded by the charismatic otaku http://anidb.net/ch74868 [Ryuusan] and the underground idol http://anidb.net/ch74867 [Mariko]. Source: ANN

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: 在宅ヲタVS現場ヲタ
Episode 1
Zaitaku Ota VS Genba Ota
episode.summary: Suuko, a prominent blogger and hikikomori, decides to help out Itorio, a up-and-coming idol group. Meanwhile, Ryuu-san, an idol enthusiast decides to move on and support a new idol. A battle starts to shape up between the two. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: すう子の覚醒
Episode 4
Suuko no Kakusei
episode.summary: Suuko reminisces about her past, and just what made her get into idols. Meanwhile, Mariko and Itorio both think about what`s going to take them to the major leagues. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地下アイドルとご当地アイドル
Episode 3
Chika Idol to Gotouchi Idol
episode.summary: Itorio talks with each other about how they want to focus on becoming bigger idols. Meanwhile, Mariko renews her determination on making it big. Everyone is focused on becoming the next big thing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひなみをメジャーにあげたのは...
Episode 2
Hinami o Major ni Ageta no wa...
episode.summary: Ryuu-san reminisces on how he got into idols, and how Suuko was involved in taking his love away. Not to be outdone, Ryuu-san enters into a competition with Suuko in order to see who can take their favorite idols into the big time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆりのの本音
Episode 8
Yurino no Honne
episode.summary: Yurino starts to have doubts about taking their group to the major leagues and reminisces on her past. Meanwhile, opportunities seem to start opening up for them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 進め! すう子会
Episode 7
Susume! Suuko Kai
episode.summary: Suuko helps Itorio gain fans, using her network of followers, but doing so leads to changes within Itorio... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それぞれの憂鬱
Episode 6
Sorezore no Yuuutsu
episode.summary: To become more than just local idols, the girls won`t be able to perform in Fukuoka anymore. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イトリオ, 初ワンマン!
Episode 5
Itorio, Hatsu One Man!
episode.summary: Itorio has their Tokyo concert, and their fans have a great time. The place is packed, full of energy. Everyone`s surprised at how great things are going. At this rate, they can make it big. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目指せ, メジャーデビュー!
Episode 11
Mezase, Major Debut!
もっと, 上に行きたい
Episode 10
Motto, Ue ni Ikitai
episode.summary: I want to be a star! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マリ子の事情
Episode 9
Mariko no Jijou
episode.summary: Mariko keeps working hard to further her dreams, while Suuko`s efforts seem to be paying off for Itorio. Meanwhile, Yurino finally confronts the rest of the group about their future. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ミリオンドール第1回ファンミーティング 在宅ヲタも現場ヲタもまとめてみんな盛り上がっちゃおうスペシャル!!!
Episode S1
Million Doll Dai-1-kai Fan Meeting: Zaitaku Ota mo Genba Ota mo Matomete Minna Moriagacchaou Special!!!
episode.summary: The Million Doll Live Show! Source: crunchyroll
